alert.note: Alert for Eastern Black Range Foothills; Southern Gila Highlands, Black Range (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Air Quality Alert issued June 02 at 3:02PM MDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...AIR QUALITY ALERT IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM MDT FRIDAY... The New Mexico Departments of Health and Environment has issued an Air Quality Alert, until 1 PM MDT Friday. An Air Quality Alert for Smoke has been issued. * WHAT... Localized areas of unhealthy air quality will continue for areas near the black fire in the Gila National Forest. Outflow winds from afternoon or evening shower/thunderstorm activity just east of the Black fire may push smoke further west and southwest into areas near the Gila Cliff Dwellings, Mimbres Valley and vicinity of Kingston and Hillsboro. Outside the immediate Black fire area, smoke impacts from other large fires in the state are not expected to be either widespread or significant. * WHERE... Significant impacts will be focused across western Socorro, Catron, northeast Grant, and far western Sierra counties. More details on impacted locations and latest air quality information can be found at https://fire.airnow.gov. * WHEN... Now through at least 1PM MDT Friday, June 3.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Black Range Foothills; Southern Gila Highlands, Black Range
